intro: Drypetes madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar drypetes, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. This species is often found in dry forests and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat.
